title: Overnight Custodian & Monitor
description:
Seasonal Full Time (2)

LaRonge SK

Proudly building upon a 60 year heritage of aviation excellence, and employing a diverse fleet of fixed wing aircraft on wheels, skis and floats; Rise Air continues to be the largest Scheduled, Charter and MEDEVAC aviation operation in Saskatchewan. Rise Air has opportunities for Overnight Custodian & Monitor for this summer float season in LaRonge, Saskatchewan

Job Purpose

The Overnight Custodian & Monitor is responsible for the overall monitoring of the building, parking lot, aircrafts and dock as well as light custodial duties at each location. This may include, but is not limited to, monitoring CCTV system, ensuring the security of the building, parking lot, aircrafts, and ground equipment at the water base. All work is completed in accordance with Rise Air standards, policies and procedures.

Responsibilities
  • Monitor CCTV system.
  • Monitor building, parking lot, aircrafts and ground equipment at water base.
  • Liaise with RCMP when necessary.
  • Custodial duties including, but not limited to:
  • Tidying the office area,
  • Cleaning the washroom,
  • Dusting, sweeping and vacuuming,
  • Tidying common areas.
Qualifications

Education and Experience
  • High School diploma is preferred.
  • WHMIS and Dangerous Goods Awareness Training is an asset.
  • Previous experience in a similar role is preferred.
  • A combination of education and experience may be considered.
Skills, Knowledge And Abilities
  • Acute attention to detail and in information retention with high accuracy.
  • Comfortable speaking with law enforcement when necessary.
  • Knowledge of cleaning products, practices and safety.
  • Bondable.
Working Conditions
  • The Overnight Custodian & Monitor works from 10:00 pm to 6:00 am The shift itself is determined by the Manager in accordance with Company requirements.
  • Must be comfortable working alone.
  • No guests are permitted on site.
Typical Physical and Cognitive Demands
  • Ability to lift up to 15 pounds.
  • Able to work with minimal supervision.
  • Ability to quickly identify problems and remain calm while resolving any issues that may arise.
As this is a Safety Sensitive Position, selected candidate(s) must test negative for controlled substances and alcohol prior to employment. We appreciate all applicants, however only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Custodial Services Worker
description:
Job Description

The Custodial Services Worker cleans and maintains assigned area(s) to meet customer and client satisfaction. Essential functions and responsibilities of the position may vary by Aramark location based on client requirements and business needs.

Job Responsibilities
  • Adheres to established procedures to provide a safe working environment including aligning with OSHA, state/local, federal, and Aramark regulations
  • Maintains a clean and orderly environment to project the safety and health of others
  • Accurately maintains and cleans housekeeping equipment
  • Cleans assigned areas to Aramark and client standards and requirements
  • Follows procedures for storage and disposal of trash and transports it to designated areas
  • Reports maintenance concerns via work order requests to appropriate personnel
  • Secures the facility, ensuring building is locked/unlocked as required
  • Ensures security of company assets
This job profile does not contain a comprehensive listing of all required activities, duties, or responsibilities. Job duties, responsibilities and activities may change, or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.

Qualifications
  • Previous custodial experience preferred.
  • Able to follow basic safety procedures and precautions due to physical risks and exposure to hazardous chemicals
  • Maintains friendly, efficient, positive guest service demeanor towards guests, clients and co-workers
  • Adaptable to guests’ needs
This role may have physical demands including, but not limited to, lifting, bending, pushing, pulling and/or extended walking and standing. This role may also require uniforms and/or usage of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE).

Education

About Aramark

Our Mission

Rooted in service and united by our purpose, we strive to do great things for each other, our partners, our communities, and our planet.

At Aramark, we believe that every employee should enjoy equal employment opportunity and be free to participate in all aspects of the company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, pregnancy, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, military status, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by applicable law.

About Aramark

The people of Aramark proudly serve millions of guests every day through food, facilities, and uniform services in 19 countries around the world. Rooted in service and united by our purpose, we strive to do great things for each other, our partners, our communities, and our planet. We believe a career should develop your talents, fuel your passions, and empower your professional growth. So, no matter what you're pursuing - a new challenge, a sense of belonging, or just a great place to work - our focus is helping you reach your full potential. Learn more about working here at http://www.aramarkcareers.com or connect with us on Facebook , Instagram and Twitter .

title: Custodian (Make a Future)
description:
Job Function

An employee in this classification ensures that students and staff are provided with a clean, safe and secure environment in which to learn and work.

Reporting To

Assistant Manager of Operations (AMO) or designate.

Illustrative Examples Of Work
  • Carries out the assigned custodial responsibilities in accordance with the established routines safety protocols and procedures.
  • Maintains the security and order of the facility, including alarming the building at the end of the shift.
  • Provides access for approved community groups.
  • Moves furniture within buildings as required for various activities as assigned by the supervisor.
  • Performs minor maintenance and repairs, e.g., soap and towel dispensers, light bulb replacements and equipment.
  • Reports items for work order submissions to the AMO or designated site administrator.
  • Maintains an adequate inventory of custodial supplies at the site.
  • Performs other assigned job-related duties within this classification.
Required Abilities And Qualifications
  • Grade 12 or equivalent.
  • Successful completion of a Certified Building Service Worker Level one and two from a recognized institution. (minimum 40 hours instruction).
  • Six months work experience in an institutional or commercial operation.
  • Demonstrated ability to perform and learn manual tasks, including the lifting of medium heavy loads, working overhead and working on a ladder.
  • Good interpersonal, oral and written skills.
  • Ability to work independently.
  • Ability to communicate and work effectively with staff and public.
Applications must include proof of qualifications and references. Please apply at https://bit.ly/3jvndcF.

Successful applicants must successfully complete an Authorization for Criminal Records Search pursuant to the Criminal records Review Act.

Value

title: Addictions Crisis Worker
description:
Concurrent Disorder Mobile Crisis Worker – Northwest Toronto Community Crisis Services (Full Time – Permanent)

The Role and Opportunity

  The NTCCS Is Governed In Partnership With a Collaborative Which Includes The Following Organizations

The Canadian Mental Health Association is looking for a Concurrent Disorder Mobile Crisis Worker for the newly funded Northwest Toronto Community Crisis Service (NTCCS). This service provides 24/7 support to people experiencing a mental health and/or addiction crisis in northwest Toronto.  This pilot program is part of a City of Toronto police reform initiative that is evaluating the effectiveness and impact of non-police-led responses to people experiencing non-emergency crises.  This program aims to reduce the harms experienced by people who have mental health and addictions challenges as well as Black, Indigenous, racialized, LGBTQ2+ and other marginalized individuals.
  • Addiction Services Central Ontario
  • Black Creek Community Health Centre
  • Black Health Alliance
  • Canadian Mental Health Association Toronto
  • Caribbean African Canadian Social Services
  • Jane Finch Centre
  • Rexdale Community Health Centre
  • Yorktown Family Services
Canadian Mental Health Association (CMHA) is the most established and extensive community mental health organization in Canada. We identify and respond to Canada’s most pressing mental health and addictions priorities. At the national level, we push for nationwide system and policy change. At the community level, millions of people in Canada rely on CMHA’s extensive grassroots presence. Since 1918, CMHA has grown to provide mental health services and supports across Canada in over 330 communities. CMHA Toronto was, established in 1953. CMHA Toronto proudly provides services to over 10,000 clients per year, in 31 programs at 13 locations across the City of Toronto. Our services are delivered by a passionate and diverse team.  Join us in providing high quality mental health and addictions services, advocating for a better mental health and addiction system, and providing education and mental health and addiction supports to clients across Toronto. 

Responsibilities

The Concurrent Disorder Mobile Crisis Worker will be part of a multi-disciplinary Mobile Crisis Response Team, which will provide crisis response 24 hours a day, 7 hours a week. This team is a multidisciplinary team of community crisis specialists that may include nurses, peer specialists, mental health clinicians, and concurrent disorders specialists. The Concurrent Disorder Mobile Crisis Worker will incorporate experiences in crisis assessment and intervention, de-escalation, harm reduction, suicide prevention, anti-oppressive practice, client-centered and recovery-oriented care, trauma-informed care, and culturally competent care to support individuals experiencing crisis in Northwest Toronto. Reporting to the Program Manager, the Concurrent Disorder Specialist will work within the context of CMHA’s mission and strategic directions.

The Concurrent Disorders Specialist will exercise sound judgement to employ de-escalation strategies and provide suicide and risk assessments and interventions. The Concurrent Disorders Specialist will have excellent clinical assessment skills to develop safety and support plans to address immediate, intermediate and long-range needs. The Concurrent Disorders Specialist will work collaboratively with the person, their family, and other health service providers to facilitate access to community resources as needed.

The Concurrent Disorders Specialist will participate in community outreach and liaison with key stakeholders and partners and maintain trusting, respectful and collaborative relationships with clients, families, colleagues, referral sources, service providers and the public.

The Concurrent Disorders Specialist will maintain accurate and timely clinical and non-clinical records and actively participate in developing, implementing, and evaluating the Northwest Toronto Community Crisis Service through meetings, training, strategic planning and evaluation initiatives.

Skills You Bring

The ideal candidate will have at minimum an Undergraduate Degree/Diploma in Social or Health Services and a certificate in Addictions. The candidate will have a minimum of three years of community mental health and addictions experience with a strong knowledge of clinical and crisis assessments, crisis intervention strategies, Trauma-Informed Care service delivery and strengths-based models. The candidate will have demonstrated skill in client-centred and recovery-oriented care.

The candidate will bring an understanding and knowledge of working with persons with mental health and/or addictions issues as well as an understanding of the intersectionality of systemic barriers and social determinants of health. The candidate will require strong knowledge of systemic and structural factors (SDoMH) that impact Black, Indigenous, racialized and LGBTQ2S+ communities. The candidate will have knowledge and/or experience of community services in the northwest Toronto area including Black Creek, Downsview, Rexdale, and Humber neighbourhoods.

The candidate will possess excellent communication, interpersonal and problem-solving skills and the ability to work as part of an interdisciplinary team. The candidate will have proficiency in Microsoft Office applications. The candidate must be able to work shifts that include overnight, weekends and holidays. Fluency in a second language and experience working with diverse communities is considered an asset. A valid Driver’s Licence is required.

WHY CHOOSE CMHA TORONTO?

Our Benefits Include

If you care about mental illness and mental health and you have the right skills, then CMHA Toronto may be the place for you. We have a positive and fair workplace culture, where staff are provided with opportunities for learning and advancement. We are also big believers in wellness and work-life balance.
  • Health Care of Ontario Pension Plan (HOOPP), a predictable, secure monthly income upon retirement 
  • Comprehensive Group Health Insurance – Health, Dental, Vision, Paramedicals 
  • Short-term and Long-term Disability programs and life insurance to protect your income upon illness or injury 
  • Work-life balance and flexibility – to ensure you have time for the things that matter to you 
  • Annual Professional Development Funding for career learning and advancement 
  • Work with like-minded, passionate individuals and make an impact on mental health service delivery 
  • Build genuine and authentic connections, with colleagues and clients, with the goal of making a difference 
Salary: $53,056 – $65,806

Hours of Work: Rotational 12 hour shifts from 7am to 7pm and 7pm to 7am; 3 days on and 4 days off

CMHA Toronto is committed to promoting a workplace culture of inclusion, openness, mutual respect, and a ‘no blame and accountable’ environment. Our staff report that they value the flexibility in work schedules and the work-life balance CMHA Toronto encourages. They appreciate the training and development opportunities provided to staff and the encouragement for continuous learning. Staff often comment on the sense of family and personal support that exists throughout the organization.

CMHA Toronto is committed to an equitable, diverse, inclusive, anti-racist and anti-oppressive workforce reflecting the diversity of the communities within which we work and is an equal opportunity employer. As such, we encourage equity-seeking candidates to apply, especially those who identify as black, Indigenous, people and women of colour, people with disabilities, 2SLGBTQ+ or women. We recognize and honour the intersectionality of equity-based identities. Personal experience with mental health issues, either through self or a loved one, is an asset. If you are contacted by our offices regarding a job opportunity, please advise prior to the interview should you require any accommodation.

To be eligible for this role candidates will be required to adhere to our COVID-19 policy and provide proof of vaccination.

title: 2 - Supervised Access Visitation Workers (SAV) Evenings & Weekends (Ki-Low-Na Friendship Society)
description:
Job Posting: (2 ) Supervised Access Visitation Workers (SAV)

Hours: Part-time hours: 4-10 hour a week. Evenings & Weekends

Wage: Depending on experience

Posted: April 14/22

Closing: Until positon filled- Cover letter

Nature Of Position

The SAV worker will provide supervision for Aboriginal families with children in care in a designated visit room or within the community. The SAV will observe and document visits in a neutral and non-judgmental manner.

Duties
  • Facilitate safe arrival and departure of children at the center
  • Provide a supervised environment where access can occur and ensure that visits only occur in designated areas
  • Provide neutral and culturally sensitive third party observation of the nature of the visit
  • Record notes on visits that are accurate, objective and contain factual information on activities, child and parent behavior and interaction, communication skill and other details of visit
  • Ensure that participants abide by the rules set out by their social worker and those of Ki-Low-Na Friendship Society
  • Assist children and parents in engaging at start of visits and disengaging at end of visits
  • Encourage a positive child/parent relationship by assisting parents in selecting age appropriate toys/activities
  • Assist with general care of infants/children and model safe interactions with infant/children when necessary (ex: diaper changes, bottle feeding etc.)
Qualifications
  • Knowledge of conflict resolution
  • Knowledge of child development and effective parenting skills
  • Ability to work with minimal supervision and as part of a team
  • Ability to demonstrate effective oral and written communication
  • Must have experience with infants and children
Requirements
  • Must be available weeknights and weekends
  • Have reliable transportation
  • Must consent to a criminal record check
Send Resumė to: Ki-Low-Na Friendship Society

442 Leon Ave

Kelowna, BC V1Y 6J3

E-mail: employmentsupport@kfs.bc.ca

Fax: (250) 861-5514

Telephone: (250) 763-4905

We thank all applicants for their interest; however, only individuals selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Staff Lodges Custodian
description:
Why join us?

We work and play in Canada's most beautiful playground, Banff National Park, and you can too. Sunshine Village is the premier ski resort in Western Canada. If you want to be part of making our guests' ski experience unforgettable and think a winter season skiing and riding on the best powder in the Rockies would be great too, then read on for more information...

The Perks
  • FREE - Your staff pass is your ticket to ride Sunshine!
  • Ski & Ride - Free days & discounts at resorts across Canada
  • Staff Events - Staff parties, BBQs, spring night skiing, dog sledding, ice climbing & more
  • Career - Recognition programs & Career development opportunities
  • Wellness - discounted fitness passes, yoga, onsite support & professional support
  • Onsite discounts - Food & beverage, retail, & hotel stays
  • Exclusive deals - Brand-named gear & local businesses
  • And much, much more!
What can you expect?

Staff Lodges Custodians provide an outstanding experience for our staff. They are responsible for cleaning and maintaining the washrooms and common areas of our staff lodges, as well as general cleanliness around the buildings. This is a physically demanding position requiring manual labour, lifting, and carrying.

This job might be right for you if you think you would really enjoy:
  • Beautiful mountains and nature at your door step
  • Being a lean, mean cleaning machine!
  • Looking after the cleanliness of our national park
  • Being welcoming and sharing your knowledge about our awesome resort with our guests.
  • Opportunity to extend contract into the Winter 2021/22
  • Above average hourly wage rate
And You Have
  • Previous professional cleaning experience (an asset)
  • Excellent time management, problem solving and team work skills
  • An energetic, self-motivated and positive attitude.
Staff Accommodation Available On Mountain But Not Essential.

 Can't wait to get started? Great, because we can't wait to hear from you! Apply online at SkiBanff.com/jobs/ and tell us why you're the next awesome member of our team. Remember, we're looking for people who will wow our guests, so start now and wow us.

Other Details
  • Pay Type Hourly
  • Employment Indicator Seasonal

title: Yard Worker
description:
Description

Job Summary:

You are a Yard Worker who is responsible for the daily flow of material including accurate shipping, receiving, and inventory control. You are responsible for the daily upkeep and maintenance of a lay down yard. You make certain that the Yard is a safe and clean space, and you assist with stock management, and maintenance on equipment and fleet vehicles.

Join our Technical Services team in Whistler, BC today!

Essential Responsibilities
  • Verifies incoming and outgoing materials
  • Administers inventory control and order selection
  • Oversees opening and closing duties as needed in the Yard
  • Supports with the daily upkeep of the yard including organizing stock and yard maintenance
  • Supports shipping and receiving activities
  • Operates forklifts and lifts heavy items (up to 40 lbs.)
  • Drives to client yards to collect materials
  • Builds and maintains relationships with field teams
  • Administers inventory control and order selection
  • Monitors yard activities ensuring that proper processes are followed
Qualifications
  • 1-2 years of Warehouse/Yard work experience, preferably in a high-volume environment
  • Experience in establishing relationships with various levels of an organization
  • Proficiency with Excel, Outlook, MS Teams
  • Ability to work unsupervised
  • Ability to communicate effectively and independently
  • Forklift Operator Certification is required
  • Successful completion of pre-employment drug & alcohol requirements and a Security Clearance Process
  • 1-2 years of industry experience, preferably in an outdoor/yard environment
  • Valid Class 5 driver’s license and clean driver’s abstract is required
  • Strong interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills, paired with a positive attitude
  • Must be fully vaccinated and provide valid COVID-19 vaccination record (unless you have a legitimate recognized medical or religious reason for not getting vaccinated)
Work Conditions
  • This role requires working primarily outdoors in various weather conditions
Company Description

Additional Information:

Ledcor Technical Services (LTS) designs, builds, and maintains wireline or wireless networks that span North America and beyond. We are a proven leader and innovator in telecommunications network construction, maintenance, and service installation and repair.

But when you work for Ledcor, your experience will go far beyond the project. Do you want a career that means more? Join our True Blue team now!

Employment Equity

At Ledcor we believe diversity, equity, and inclusion should be part of everything we do. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or any other identifying characteristic are encouraged to apply.

Our True Blue team consists of individuals from all backgrounds who contribute diverse perspectives and experiences to Ledcor. We are committed to continuing to build on our culture of empowerment, inclusion and belonging.

View our full Inclusion & Diversity statement here .

title: Yard Worker / Detailer / Handyperson
description:
Job description

This job is a critical cog in the Iron Wind Marine machine. The role demands a person with great common sense and a can do attitude. As the principle support person for logistics (moving boats) testing (running boats) and final unit preparation (detailing boats) for delivery this role requires someone with a range of skills.

If you're tired of doing the same old thing over and over and want to have variety in your day this job will provide it. Towing, launching, retrieving boats, cleaning boats, shrink wrapping, coordination of the movement of boats in and out of the service shop, lot checks to ensure our clients boats are in good condition, minor property repairs, assisting setting up boat shows are just some of the things that this position gets to work on.


What is detailing?

In boat detailer jobs, you have various duties, including cleaning the boat in detail, applying wax, and working to make the boat look like new. As well as applying paint to the bottom of boats. An eye for detail is important to ensure our clients receive their boat in tip top condition. Boat detailer is a very physically demanding job. You should be able to be on your feet for extended periods. Ideally candidates would have prior experience detailing boats. Experience in car detailing would also be considered an asset.


What is involved with Yard Work?

Yard Work involves moving boats with fork lift and truck, moving and adjusting blocks and stands, assisting with loading boats on trailers and keeping the facility clean and tidy. Once experienced a senior Yard Person will be able to operate our hydraulic trailer and our transport truck to load and move boats around the Maritimes. We are prepared to train the right candidate to operate a Class 1 vehicle.


What is a Handyperson?

A Handyperson is someone who can handle small repairs to our property and equipment as needed. This isn't a part of the job that requires extensive previous experience but rather someone who is generally reasonably good at handling general small maintenance items around the property.

We are looking for a motivated person with a great attitude that wants to learn and thrive in an interesting industry. We are looking for a long term permanent employee and we will train the right candidate in aspects of the position that they may not currently have experience with. We are looking for someone who wants a solid long term career with an established small business.


Some travel is necessary during trade show season (Feb-March-April)


Job Types: Full-time, Permanent


Valid Class 5 Drivers License (Required)

Valid Class 3 Drivers License (Preferred)

Valid Class 1 Drivers License (Would be perfect)

Pleasure Craft Operator Card (Required)


*please live within easy driving distance of Prospect Road in Halifax.

We do not participate in relocation programs overseas.

title: Overnight Custodian & Monitor
description:
Seasonal Full Time (2)

LaRonge SK

Proudly building upon a 60 year heritage of aviation excellence, and employing a diverse fleet of fixed wing aircraft on wheels, skis and floats; Rise Air continues to be the largest Scheduled, Charter and MEDEVAC aviation operation in Saskatchewan. Rise Air has opportunities for Overnight Custodian & Monitor for this summer float season in LaRonge, Saskatchewan

Job Purpose

The Overnight Custodian & Monitor is responsible for the overall monitoring of the building, parking lot, aircrafts and dock as well as light custodial duties at each location. This may include, but is not limited to, monitoring CCTV system, ensuring the security of the building, parking lot, aircrafts, and ground equipment at the water base. All work is completed in accordance with Rise Air standards, policies and procedures.

Responsibilities
  • Monitor CCTV system.
  • Monitor building, parking lot, aircrafts and ground equipment at water base.
  • Liaise with RCMP when necessary.
  • Custodial duties including, but not limited to:
  • Tidying the office area,
  • Cleaning the washroom,
  • Dusting, sweeping and vacuuming,
  • Tidying common areas.
Qualifications

Education and Experience
  • High School diploma is preferred.
  • WHMIS and Dangerous Goods Awareness Training is an asset.
  • Previous experience in a similar role is preferred.
  • A combination of education and experience may be considered.
Skills, Knowledge And Abilities
  • Acute attention to detail and in information retention with high accuracy.
  • Comfortable speaking with law enforcement when necessary.
  • Knowledge of cleaning products, practices and safety.
  • Bondable.
Working Conditions
  • The Overnight Custodian & Monitor works from 10:00 pm to 6:00 am The shift itself is determined by the Manager in accordance with Company requirements.
  • Must be comfortable working alone.
  • No guests are permitted on site.
Typical Physical and Cognitive Demands
  • Ability to lift up to 15 pounds.
  • Able to work with minimal supervision.
  • Ability to quickly identify problems and remain calm while resolving any issues that may arise.
As this is a Safety Sensitive Position, selected candidate(s) must test negative for controlled substances and alcohol prior to employment. We appreciate all applicants, however only those selected for interviews will be contacted.

title: Shipper-Receiver-Yard Worker
description:
As the leader in thermoplastic piping systems, the IPEX companies design and manufacture the largest, most recognized and diverse range of integrated piping products – Everything professionals need to manage the full spectrum of today’s municipal, industrial, commercial and residential challenges.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

The Distribution Center staff’s responsibility is to accurately and quickly service a very demanding client base while maintaining the highest quality and safety standards in the industry. You will get the opportunity to do a little bit of everything! In this role, you will report to the distribution manager and carry out daily tasks at the St-John’s New-Brunswick distribution center.
  • Perform duties within the RF processes in place;
  • Accurately pick, stack, wrap and stage outbound freight; to ensure warehouse goals are met;
  • Cycle Counts;
  • Stock Replenishment;
  • Receiving and locating product using RF technology;
  • Execute work in the prescribed sequence so deliver-by-date is met;
  • Maintain a strict housekeeping standard in accordance with 5S protocols;
  • Work proficiently to meet Productivity, Quality and Safety targets;
  • Apply and comply with HSE guidelines and C-TPAT policies;
  • Report unsafe work conditions/environment in a timely basis. Maintain equipment and report malfunctions;
  • Commit to the success of the team;
  • Any other related tasks requested by the superior.

Requirements
  • Completion of a high-school diploma or relevant experience;
  • Ability to meet daily deadlines and to work in an environment where assignments and work priorities are reviewed several times a day;
  • Must be able to use RF technology;
  • Able to read and write in English;
  • Previous experience working in a warehouse preferred;
  • Previous experience operating forklifts preferred;
  • Ability to stay on your feet for long periods at a time;
  • Ability to work well as a team but be self-motivated and independent at times;
  • Good communication skills and some computer knowledge;
  • Diligent and Punctual;
  • Ability to lift 5 to 50 pounds repeatedly.

Benefits
  • Eligibility for comprehensive health and dental benefits and RRSP- matching program after 3 months of service
  • Annual bonus and incentive programs

title: Saltwater Aquaculture Worker
description:
SALTWATER AQUACULTURE WORKER

Cold Ocean Salmon Inc., a division of Cooke Aquaculture Inc., a dynamic and growing east coast family company, with Platinum Member status in the Canada’s Best Managed Companies Program, is offering a unique opportunity for a highly motivated individual to join the Company’s team as Aquaculture Site and Maintenance Vessel Workers.

Cooke is a global seafood company with operations in North America, Europe, and South America. Our company’s success is driven by our dynamic, highly-skilled and innovative management team, supported by dedicated employees who live in coastal communities and contribute to the local area’s economy and sense of community.

The Role

The primary duties include, but are not limited to
  • Monitoring and operating the feeding systems.
  • Report any observed irregularities in stocks.
  • Grid installation and inspection/repair.
  • Marine cage and net installation and removal.
  • Operate, maintain, and clean aquaculture equipment and enclosures.
  • General site maintenance including net washing.
  • Operation of boats for aquaculture operations.
  • Grade and weigh aquaculture stock.
  • Harvest assistance as required.
The ideal candidate will be a self-motivated team player willing to work flexible work hours and schedules. You must have the ability to work in outside weather conditions on aquaculture sites and/or aboard maintenance vessels. This is a labour-intensive position, requires standing for long periods of time, and applicants must be comfortable working in outside weather conditions on both aquaculture sites and aboard maintenance vessels.
  • Applicants must hold or be willing to obtain a Marine Emergency Duties (MED) certificate
Experience within the aquaculture field would be considered an asset but not required as on the job training is provided.

Salary commensurate with experience which includes a competitive health and dental benefit package.

The Opportunity

The role description is just one part of the story. This is an opportunity to grow, to work within the parameters of the role but to reach your fullest potential. We are a team that is driven to succeed. We count performance, we reward contribution and we recognize talent. It is about being at the center of a growing, global leader in seafood and knowing you are part of that growth. The ability to bring your passion for learning, desire for growth and energy for moving your career forward is what we offer.

   

The Why

Why Cooke…simple because we are a company that rewards initiative, resourcefulness and work ethic.  We will champion your growth and provide you with the platform to create your path, your career, and your future.

title: Yard Worker
description:
Description

Job Summary:

You are a Yard Worker who is responsible for the daily flow of material including accurate shipping, receiving, and inventory control. You are responsible for the daily upkeep and maintenance of a lay down yard. You make certain that the Yard is a safe and clean space, and you assist with stock management, and maintenance on equipment and fleet vehicles.

Join Ledcor Technical Services in Kelowna today!

Essential Responsibilities
  • Verifies incoming and outgoing materials
  • Administers inventory control and order selection
  • Oversees opening and closing duties as needed in the Yard
  • Supports with the daily upkeep of the yard including organizing stock and yard maintenance
  • Supports shipping and receiving activities
  • Operates forklifts and lifts heavy items (up to 40 lbs.)
  • Drives to client yards to collect materials
  • Builds and maintains relationships with field teams
  • Administers inventory control and order selection
  • Monitors yard activities ensuring that proper processes are followed
Qualifications
  • 1-2 years of Warehouse/Yard work experience, preferably in a high-volume environment
  • Experience in establishing relationships with various levels of an organization
  • Proficiency with Excel, Outlook, MS Teams
  • Ability to work unsupervised
  • Ability to communicate effectively and independently
  • Forklift Operator Certification is required
  • Successful completion of pre-employment drug & alcohol requirements and a Security Clearance Process
  • 1-2 years of industry experience, preferably in an outdoor/yard environment
  • Valid Class 5 driver’s license and clean driver’s abstract is required
  • Strong interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills, paired with a positive attitude
  • Must be fully vaccinated and provide valid COVID-19 vaccination record (unless you have a legitimate recognized medical or religious reason for not getting vaccinated)
Work Conditions
  • This role requires working primarily outdoors in various weather conditions
  • Travel required up to 100% of the time
Company Description

Additional Information:

Ledcor Technical Services (LTS) designs, builds, and maintains wireline or wireless networks that span North America and beyond. We are a proven leader and innovator in telecommunications network construction, maintenance, and service installation and repair.

But when you work for Ledcor, your experience will go far beyond the project. Do you want a career that means more? Join our True Blue team now!

Employment Equity

At Ledcor we believe diversity, equity, and inclusion should be part of everything we do. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or any other identifying characteristic are encouraged to apply.

Our True Blue team consists of individuals from all backgrounds who contribute diverse perspectives and experiences to Ledcor. We are committed to continuing to build on our culture of empowerment, inclusion and belonging.

View our full Inclusion & Diversity statement here .

Date Posted

Apr 25, 2022
  • , Vernon, BC, Canada

title: Manufacturing Worker
description:
Job Description

Drake International are currently hiring for a growing Manufacturing Facility in the Brockville area.

This growth has allowed the company to create new jobs within the facility and they would like to hear from experienced Production Workers in medium to heavy settings.

If you are interested in FULL-TIME work and are comfortable with rotating 12-hour shifts, then consider the following.
  • You must have general math and English skills.
  • You must have a hands-on mechanical aptitude and willing to work around heavy equipment. Experience is preferred but this can be learned.
  • Long hours on your feet in an industrial setting is tough, but you are only working half the year!
  • Able to work in a team-based environment and have attention to detail. Most importantly ask clarifying questions!
  • Clear Background check is required.
  • Covid protocols in place.
  • Great starting salary ($19.80) and growth opportunities within the first year up to $22.45 hourly.

If this sounds like the opportunity for you, apply today! Please note that only qualified candidates will be contacted.

About Drake International:

Since 1951, Drake International continues to be a global leader in flexible and permanent staffing: we help businesses find the perfect candidate and job seekers find the perfect career in Canada and across the globe. Connect with us today.

INDBrockville

Refer a Friend

Introduce your friends to Drake and we will pay you up to $500* if we place your friend in a permanent position. You can also earn $50* if we place your friend in a temporary assignment. * Please see your local branch for details. (Offer not available in the province of BC)

title: Food Prep Worker
location: Les Laurentides Regional County Municipality, Quebec, Canada
description:
Job Description

The Food Prep Worker prepares, and portions food items and performs various duties in accordance with production requirements and Aramark sanitation standards. Uses daily worksheets and standardized recipes to cook meals.

Job Responsibilities
  • Prepares all food items using prep lists and standard Aramark recipes.
  • Follows proper food handling procedures.
  • Maintains accurate rotation of food to assure top quality and freshness.
  • Manages leftover foods correctly; cover, label, date, and accurately store according to Aramark standards.
  • Maintains clean and orderly refrigerators and work areas.
  • Ensures stations are cleaned, sanitized, and organized at the end of the shift (including cleaning of kitchen equipment).
  • Maintains a safe and sanitary work environment that conforms to all food safety standards and regulations.
  • Follows safety policies and accident reporting procedures.
  • Completes all required training.
This job profile does not contain a comprehensive listing of all required activities, duties, or responsibilities. Job duties, responsibilities and activities may change, or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.

Qualifications
  • Minimum one-year prep work or food service-related work preferred.
  • Knowledge of food prep, proper knife handling, temperature control, and sanitation is helpful.
  • Must be able to read and write to facilitate communication with others.
  • Mathematical ability required.
Education

title: Food Prep Worker - Yosemite - Ahwahnee Hotel
description:
Job Description

The Food Prep Worker prepares, and portions food items and performs various duties in accordance with production requirements and Aramark sanitation standards. Uses daily worksheets and standardized recipes to cook meals.

Job Responsibilities
  • Prepares all food items using prep lists and standard Aramark recipes.
  • Follows proper food handling procedures.
  • Maintains accurate rotation of food to assure top quality and freshness.
  • Manages leftover foods correctly; cover, label, date, and accurately store according to Aramark standards.
  • Maintains clean and orderly refrigerators and work areas.
  • Ensures stations are cleaned, sanitized, and organized at the end of the shift (including cleaning of kitchen equipment).
  • Maintains a safe and sanitary work environment that conforms to all food safety standards and regulations.
  • Follows safety policies and accident reporting procedures.
  • Completes all required training.
This job profile does not contain a comprehensive listing of all required activities, duties, or responsibilities. Job duties, responsibilities and activities may change, or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.

Qualifications
  • Minimum one-year prep work or food service-related work preferred.
  • Knowledge of food prep, proper knife handling, temperature control, and sanitation is helpful.
  • Must be able to read and write to facilitate communication with others.
  • Mathematical ability required.
Education

title: Ouvrier/Emballeur
description:
Description De L'entreprise

Rappelez-vous la dernière fois que vous avez ouvert une bouteille de champagne, une bière fraîche après une dure journée de travail ou une bouteille d'eau minérale pétillante pour vous désaltérer… eh bien elle a probablement été fabriquée par nous ! Nous sommes O-I et, en tant que verrier, nous fabriquons quelque chose dont le monde a besoin.

O-I a plus d'un siècle d'expérience dans la fabrication d'emballages en verre pur, sain et durable pour de nombreuses marques du secteur agroalimentaire parmi les plus connues au monde. Nous sommes fiers de fournir des emballages en verre de haute qualité pour le marché de la bière, du vin, des spiritueux, de la nourriture et les boissons non alcoolisées.

Avec environ 27 000 employés et une présence inégalée grâce à près de 80 usines réparties dans 23 pays, O-I est un acteur mondial incontournable de la fabrication d’emballage en verre.

Description Du Poste

RESPONSABILITÉS

Entre autres,
  • Effectuer l’entretien du département d’emballage selon la cédule de changement de produits et d’entretien (emballage incluant les fours de recuisson, équipements d’inspection, palettisation, carton et laboratoire);
  • Utilisation de transpalette, polisseuse ainsi qu’un élévateur à ciseaux;
  • Remplir des rapports sur les actions posées;
  • Cadenasser lorsque nécessaire;
  • Effectuer les tâches de base d’un emballeur lorsque requis: Monter des palettes manuellement, Opérer les encaisseuses, Surveiller et opérer les équipements de production (machine à boites, à partitions, partitions en U, encaisseuse, etc.), Assurer un flot continu de produits, contenants et caisses, sur les convoyeurs, Effectuer des déblocages au besoin, Faire de l’inspection visuelle sur les contenants de verre pour déceler tout défaut apparent, emballer à la main au besoin.
  • Effectuer toutes autres tâches connexes.
Qualifications
  • Diplôme de fin d’études secondaires exigé ou équivalence;
  • Capacité de travailler seul et de façon consciencieuse, habileté à résoudre des problèmes;
  • Connaissance des règlements de sécurité et des règlements généraux de l’usine;
  • Flexibilité au niveau de ses heures de travail pour pouvoir répondre aux besoins de nettoyage;
  • Être disponible pour recevoir de la formation (par exemple : HACCP);
  • Ne pas avoir peur du travail en hauteur et y être à l’aise;
  • Capacité de travailler dans un environnement chaud;
  • Bonne condition physique générale.
CONDITIONS DE TRAVAIL

Type d'emploi : Temps Plein, permanent

Lieu de travail: 2376 Wellington, Montreal, QC, H3K 1X6

Salaire :19,59$ à 26,19$ (après 6 mois) par heure (+ primes), également 25,974/h après 90 jours de 12h travaillés.

Avantages : Assurances, Congés de Vacances et Compensatoires, Pensions, Environnement syndiqué

Horaire : 12 Heures Rotatifs jour et nuit (7h-19h et 19h-7h)

Mesures COVID-19 : Port du masque obligatoire

Informations complémentaires

OI est un employeur garantissant l'égalité des chances et ne discrimine aucun employé ou candidat à un emploi en raison de la race, de la couleur, du sexe, de l'âge, de l'origine nationale, de la religion, de l'orientation sexuelle, de l'identité de genre, du statut d'ancien combattant et de la base du handicap ou de tout autre classe protégée fédérale, étatique ou locale. Si, en raison d'un problème de santé ou d'un handicap, vous avez besoin d'un aménagement raisonnable pour toute partie du processus de candidature, ou afin d'exécuter les fonctions essentielles d'un poste, veuillez nous contacter et nous le faire savoir la nature de votre demande et vos coordonnées.
skills: ['Cadenasser lorsque nécessaire;']

title: Dry Custodian
description:
Description

Position at Dumas

NOW HIRING: DRY CUSTODIAN (Lalor Project)

Dumas is a leading full-service underground mining contractor providing services to clients throughout the Americas. Over the past 23 years, Dumas has completed over 500 projects in 10 countries, for over 40 clients.

Dry Custodian

Under the direction of the Project Superintendent the Dry Custodian is primarily responsible for cleaning the mine dry(s), washrooms and office areas.

Responsibilities

Daily clean the mine dry(s), washrooms and offices

Ensure to maintain an adequate supply of materials

Required Qualifications
  • Safe work record
  • Thorough knowledge of safety, health and environmental regulations as they pertain to the workplace
  • Ability to lift up to 50 lbs.
  • At least 1 year’s experience in a similar position preferred
  • Able to work long shifts on a rotational basis, 7/7 schedule.
  • Must be local or have own accommodations
Why Join Us?
  • Commitment to a healthy and safe working environment
  • Excellent compensation and comprehensive benefits
  • Performance-based financial rewards
  • Training and career development
To Apply.....

Send us your resume and transcripts via our website, www.dumasmining.com. There is a spot on the Careers page to upload your paperwork.

Dumas Contracting Inc. is committed to an environment that is barrier free. If you require accommodation during the hiring process, please inform us in advance so that we can arrange reasonable and appropriate accommodation.

We really appreciate the interest of all applicants; however, only those candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.

title: Attendant Services Worker / Caregiver
description:
Independent Living Waterloo Region is looking to hire an Attendant Services Worker / Caregiver to provide in-home care to people with disabilities at our assisted living sites, and community outreach in Kitchener, Waterloo, and Cambridge. Are you experienced in caring for people with disabilities? Do you want a job with an organization that values your skills and talents? Would you like to help the people you serve achieve happiness through independence? If so, please read on!

Position Summary

As an Attendant Services Worker / Caregiver, you are passionate about helping people in our community who experience disabilities. Your day consists of providing our clients assistance with the activities of daily living. You help them with their personal care routines, such as grooming, toileting, bathing, and oral maintenance. You also perform some light housekeeping, linen changes, and meal preparation. If a client needs therapeutic intervention, you assist with range-of-motion therapy, breathing assistance, or whatever other procedures are listed in the client's care plan.

KEY RESPONSBILITIES
  • Providing total personal care such as toileting, bathing, and perineal care.
  • Grooming, including oral care
  • Assist consumer with dressing and undressing
  • Assist in feeding consumers who are unable to feed themselves
  • Support good skin care to prevent skin breakdown (i.e. turn and reposition client, actively encourage movement)
  • Breathing Assistance (e.g. tracheostomy, respirator)
  • Assist client with active and passive range of motions as defined by the care plan.
  • Provide consumer with help walking and transferring
  • Assist consumer in the self-administration of medication.
  • Perform light housekeeping
  • Perform meal preparation and clean up
  • Change bed linens and make up the consumers bed
  • Maintain an orderly client environment.
Qualifications
  • High school diploma
  • Certification in CPR and first aid OR a willingness to become certified
  • Driver's license, a personal vehicle, and a willingness to travel to our service areas. (ex. Assisted Living Sites and/or Community Outreach)
  • Proof of full COVID-19 immunization
  • Experience working with persons with disabilities or in convalescent care.
  • Willing to work in home-care environment that may include exposure to bodily fluids, household cleaners, pets, and fluctuating room temperature.
A completed home service worker (HSW) or personal service worker (PSW) certificate would be preferred, but experience working/volunteering related fields is also considered. Do you have excellent people skills? Are you kind and patient? Can you work hard to ensure the well-being of our clients? If yes, you might just be perfect for this home care / personal support position!

JOB DETAILS

Status: Part-Time, Permanent

Hours: Approx. 16-32 Hrs/Week

Primary Location: Waterloo and Surrounding Area

Starting Wage: $18.75/Hour + $3/Hour pandemic temporary wage enhancement on direct service hours

WORK SCHEDULE

This position works a rotating schedule of mornings, afternoons, evenings, and alternating weekends, for example, 6:30 am - 2:30 pm or 2:30 pm - 11:00 pm.

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this home care / personal support job, please fill out our initial application on our website. We look forward to meeting you!

ILWR is committed to developing an inclusive, barrier-free selection process and work environment. We seek to provide accessibility for all applicants with disabilities consistent with our accessibility policies and the AODA. Please let us know if you require an accommodation and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs. We thank all applicants; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted

(ex. title: Yard Worker
description:
Description

Job Summary:

You are a Yard Worker who is responsible for the daily flow of material including accurate shipping, receiving, and inventory control. You are responsible for the daily upkeep and maintenance of a lay down yard. You make certain that the Yard is a safe and clean space, and you assist with stock management, and maintenance on equipment and fleet vehicles.

Join Ledcor Technical Services in Lillooet today!

Essential Responsibilities
  • Verifies incoming and outgoing materials
  • Administers inventory control and order selection
  • Oversees opening and closing duties as needed in the Yard
  • Supports with the daily upkeep of the yard including organizing stock and yard maintenance
  • Supports shipping and receiving activities
  • Operates forklifts and lifts heavy items (up to 40 lbs.)
  • Drives to client yards to collect materials
  • Builds and maintains relationships with field teams
  • Administers inventory control and order selection
  • Monitors yard activities ensuring that proper processes are followed
Qualifications
  • 1-2 years of Warehouse/Yard work experience, preferably in a high-volume environment
  • Experience in establishing relationships with various levels of an organization
  • Proficiency with Excel, Outlook, MS Teams
  • Ability to work unsupervised
  • Ability to communicate effectively and independently
  • Forklift Operator Certification is required
  • Successful completion of pre-employment drug & alcohol requirements and a Security Clearance Process
  • 1-2 years of industry experience, preferably in an outdoor/yard environment
  • Valid Class 5 driver’s license and clean driver’s abstract is required
  • Strong interpersonal, organizational, and communication skills, paired with a positive attitude
  • Travel required up to 100% of the time
  • Must be fully vaccinated and provide valid COVID-19 vaccination record (unless you have a legitimate recognized medical or religious reason for not getting vaccinated)
Work Conditions
  • This role requires working primarily outdoors in various weather conditions
Company Description

Additional Information:

Ledcor Technical Services (LTS) designs, builds, and maintains wireline or wireless networks that span North America and beyond. We are a proven leader and innovator in telecommunications network construction, maintenance, and service installation and repair.

But when you work for Ledcor, your experience will go far beyond the project. Do you want a career that means more? Join our True Blue team now!

Employment Equity

At Ledcor we believe diversity, equity, and inclusion should be part of everything we do. We are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. All qualified individuals, regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, gender identity or any other identifying characteristic are encouraged to apply.

Our True Blue team consists of individuals from all backgrounds who contribute diverse perspectives and experiences to Ledcor. We are committed to continuing to build on our culture of empowerment, inclusion and belonging.

View our full Inclusion & Diversity statement here .

Date Posted

Apr 28, 2022
  • , Squamish, BC, Canada

Join Ledcor Technical Services in Lillooet today!

title: Facility Custodian
description:
From $24 to $28 per hour

Toronto Branch

3333 James Snow Parkway North, Milton, ON L9T 8L1

From spotless warehouses to manicured lawns and walking trails, maintaining world-class facilities is as important to Uline as providing quality products and great service. Join a Facilities team that helps manage over 16 million square feet of property on over 50 million square feet of grounds.

Position Responsibilities
  • Perform general labour to support operation requirements as needed.
  • Sweeping, mopping, wiping racks, yard maintenance, building maintenance, etc.
  • Process trash removal and corrugated scraps with a compactor.
  • Clean restrooms.
  • Operate floor scrubber (electric or propane) and other equipment.
  • Set up and clean employee workspaces.
  • Assist with meeting set-up and teardown.
Minimum Requirements
  • High school diploma or equivalent.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Previous custodial / cleaning experience required.
  • Ability to lift and / or move up to 50 lbs.
Benefits
  • Extended medical and health coverage that includes medical, dental and vision.
  • Basic life insurance, disability and wellness programs.
  • RRSP with 5% employer match.
  • Paid holidays and generous paid time off.
  • Bonus programs that include annual performance, sales goals and profit sharing.
Employee Perks
  • Best-in-class, clean, modern facilities.
  • First-class fitness center.
About Uline

Uline is North America's leading distributor of shipping, industrial and packaging materials. We're a family-owned company known for incredible service, quality products and same-day shipping of our huge in-stock inventory. With over 8,000 employees across 12 locations, it's time you joined Uline.

Uline is proud to operate as a drug-free workplace.

Uline is an Equal Opportunity Employer

(#IN-TOROF)

Our employees make the difference and we are committed to offering exceptional benefits and perks! Explore Uline.jobs to learn more!

title: LAUNDRY WORKER III (CASUAL)
description:
If you are looking for friendly, supportive staff, work life balance and affordable living this may be just the opportunity that will take your career to a new level.

In accordance with established vision and values of the organization and working within the scope of Regional Northern Health Policies and Processes, the Laundry Worker III operates non-domestic laundry equipment such as washers/tunnel washers, extractors, dryers, etc. and provides supervision to designated Laundry Workers by performing duties such as scheduling and coordinating work assignments, and determining related training and orientation requirements.

Kitimat General Hospital is a 19 acute bed hospital with a full range of services. Some services provided are emergency, laboratory, diagnostic imaging, outpatient chemotherapy clinic, physiotherapy, diabetes and chronic disease management. Regular rotation of visiting specialists in internal medicine, urology, otorhinolaryngology (ENT), dermatology, neurology, ophthalmology, and radiology.

Kitimat has a population of 8,131 (2020) local residents. Kitimat offers excellent fishing, endless trails, and backcountry. People come to Kitimat to enjoy more of the things you love. Check out Kitimat where there is always something new to experience.

What Northern Health has to offer you!
  • Comprehensive benefit packages including MSP, extended health/dental and a municipal pension plan for part-time and full-time employees. Casuals have the option of paying for benefits.
  • Four weeks vacation with one year of continuous service
  • Relocation Incentive is available for eligible positions
  • Employee referral program
  • Employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
  • Spectacular outdoor activities and the shortest commutes in BC
  • “Loan Forgiveness Programs” offered through the Federal and BC Government
  • Grade 10, plus two years' recent related experience in a commercial or industrial laundry or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Skills And Abilities
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.
  • Ability to organize work.
  • Some knowledge of washing ingredients.
Who We Are

Northern Health covers an area of nearly 600,000 square kilometers and offers health services in over two dozen communities and 55 First Nation’s communities. We deliver hospital and community-based health care for a population of 300,000.

Employing more than 7,000 staff throughout the region, Northern Health provides exceptional health services for Northerners, through the efforts of dedicated staff and physicians, in partnership with communities and organizations in Northern BC.

There is a wide variety of career opportunities available in our two dozen hospitals, 25 long-term care facilities, public health units and many other offices providing specialized services.

title: Custodial Services Worker
description:
Job Description

The Custodial Services Worker cleans and maintains assigned area(s) to meet customer and client satisfaction. Essential functions and responsibilities of the position may vary by Aramark location based on client requirements and business needs.

Job Responsibilities
  • Adheres to established procedures to provide a safe working environment including aligning with OSHA, state/local, federal, and Aramark regulations
  • Maintains a clean and orderly environment to project the safety and health of others
  • Accurately maintains and cleans housekeeping equipment
  • Cleans assigned areas to Aramark and client standards and requirements
  • Follows procedures for storage and disposal of trash and transports it to designated areas
  • Reports maintenance concerns via work order requests to appropriate personnel
  • Secures the facility, ensuring building is locked/unlocked as required
  • Ensures security of company assets
This job profile does not contain a comprehensive listing of all required activities, duties, or responsibilities. Job duties, responsibilities and activities may change, or new ones may be assigned at any time with or without notice.

Qualifications
  • Previous custodial experience preferred.
  • Able to follow basic safety procedures and precautions due to physical risks and exposure to hazardous chemicals
  • Maintains friendly, efficient, positive guest service demeanor towards guests, clients and co-workers
  • Adaptable to guests’ needs
This role may have physical demands including, but not limited to, lifting, bending, pushing, pulling and/or extended walking and standing. This role may also require uniforms and/or usage of Personal Protective Equipment (PPE).

Education

About Aramark

Our Mission

Rooted in service and united by our purpose, we strive to do great things for each other, our partners, our communities, and our planet.

At Aramark, we believe that every employee should enjoy equal employment opportunity and be free to participate in all aspects of the company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, gender, pregnancy, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, military status, protected veteran status or other characteristics protected by applicable law.

About Aramark

The people of Aramark proudly serve millions of guests every day through food, facilities, and uniform services in 19 countries around the world. Rooted in service and united by our purpose, we strive to do great things for each other, our partners, our communities, and our planet. We believe a career should develop your talents, fuel your passions, and empower your professional growth. So, no matter what you're pursuing - a new challenge, a sense of belonging, or just a great place to work - our focus is helping you reach your full potential. Learn more about working here at http://www.aramarkcareers.com or connect with us on Facebook , Instagram and Twitter .

title: ACTIVITY WORKER II (CASUAL)
description:
If you are looking for friendly, supportive staff, work life balance and affordable living this may be just the opportunity that will take your career to a new level.

In accordance with the vision and values of the organization and under the general supervision of a senior position such as a Recreation Therapist, Program Coordinator, Registered Nurse or Occupational Therapist, the Activity Worker is a member of the multidisciplinary team within a client and family centered model of care, and is responsible for carrying out an established activity/recreation/leisure program as directed.

Stuart Nechako Manor has 45 publicly subsidized beds, 12 beds specifically for dementia residents and 2 Short Stay Beds used for Respite and Palliative needs. Stuart Nechako manor has a combination of single and double occupancy rooms. Stuart Nechako Manor provides Recreational Therapy Services 5 days a week. Pastoral and Spiritual Services are provided by the Vanderhoof Ministerial Group with regular on site spiritual care. There is a Volunteer Program in place to accompany Residents on social outings, appointments, assist with feeding and provide hospice support. Hairdressing and barber services are available on site for a fee determined by the service provider. Stuart Nechako Manor also provides an on-site integrated community adult day program, operating 3 days a week.

Vanderhoof has a population of 4,500 (2021). Nestled in the fertile Nechako Valley, on the banks of the Nechako River, rural Vanderhoof is the geographical centre of the province of British Columbia. Check out Vanderhoof where there is always something new to experience.

What Northern Health has to offer you!
  • Comprehensive benefit packages including MSP, extended health/dental and a municipal pension plan for part-time and full-time employees. Casuals have the option of paying for benefits.
  • Four weeks vacation with one year of continuous service
  • Relocation Incentive is available for eligible positions
  • Employee referral program
  • Employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
  • Spectacular outdoor activities and the shortest commutes in BC
  • “Loan Forgiveness Programs” offered through the Federal and BC Government
  • Grade 12, plus completion of recognized recreation course(s)
  • Two year’s recent, related experience or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
  • Valid class 4 vehicle license.
Skills And Abilities
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
  • Ability to organize work.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.
Who We Are

Northern Health covers an area of nearly 600,000 square kilometers and offers health services in over two dozen communities and 55 First Nation’s communities. We deliver hospital and community-based health care for a population of 300,000.

Employing more than 7,000 staff throughout the region, Northern Health provides exceptional health services for Northerners, through the efforts of dedicated staff and physicians, in partnership with communities and organizations in Northern BC.

There is a wide variety of career opportunities available in our two dozen hospitals, 25 long-term care facilities, public health units and many other offices providing specialized services.

title: Cleaner / Laundry Worker 2 (Casual)
description:
Job Title Laundry Worker 2Work Site Laundry, Adanac Park Lodge - Vancouver, BCStatus Casual Start Date As soon as possibleSalary $21.77 per hourHours VariousReference# 157950-eag

Come work as a Laundry Worker with Vancouver Coastal Health (VCH)!

Vancouver Coastal Health is looking for a Laundry Worker to join the Laundry team at Little Mountain Place in Vancouver, BC. Apply today to join our team!

As a Laundry Worker, you will perform laundry duties including sorting, folding and distributing linens. Operate domestic and well as non-domestic washers and dryers without supervision of others.

Qualifications

Education & Experience
  • Grade 10 plus recent related experience in a commercial or industrial laundry or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience.
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Ability to deal with others effectively.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
  • Ability to organize work.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.
The hours of work including days off and work area may be subject to change consistent with operational requirements and the provision of the Collective Agreement and applicable statutes. Successful applicants may be required to complete a Criminal Records Review Check.

As per the current Public Health Orders (Long Term Care/Seniors Assisted Living Provincial Health Officer Order and the Health Sector Order), as of October 26, 2021, all employees working for Vancouver Coastal Health must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Proof of vaccination status will be required.

WHY JOIN VANCOUVER COASTAL HEALTH?

VCH is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents. At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. We invite you to join us in creating healthy lives in healthy communities by showcasing our passion for care, connection to the communities we serve and our culture of teamwork that makes VCH a great place to work.
  • Comprehensive health benefits package, including MSP, extended health and dental and municipal pension plan
  • Grow your career with employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
  • Wellness supports, including counselling, critical incident and innovative wellness services are available to employees and their immediate families
  • Award-winning recognition programs to honour staff, medical staff and volunteers
  • Access to exclusive discount offers and deals for VCH staff
Diversity, equity, and inclusion are essential to our goals of creating a great place to work and delivering exceptional care. We acknowledge and accommodate unique differences and ensure special measures are in place so that all prospective and current employees are given an opportunity to succeed.

We are committed to building a representative workforce and encourage applications reflecting diversity of sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization or ancestry, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.

Vancouver Coastal Health is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers in 2022.

Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting.

***Employees of VCH must apply via the Internal Application Process. Refer to the https//my.vch.ca/working-here/job-postings site for How to Apply instructions. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***

Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.

title: Attendant Services Worker / Caregiver
description:
Independent Living Waterloo Region is looking to hire an Attendant Services Worker / Caregiver to provide in-home care to people with disabilities at our assisted living sites, and community outreach in Kitchener, Waterloo, and Cambridge. Are you experienced in caring for people with disabilities? Do you want a job with an organization that values your skills and talents? Would you like to help the people you serve achieve happiness through independence? If so, please read on!

Position Summary

As an Attendant Services Worker / Caregiver, you are passionate about helping people in our community who experience disabilities. Your day consists of providing our clients assistance with the activities of daily living. You help them with their personal care routines, such as grooming, toileting, bathing, and oral maintenance. You also perform some light housekeeping, linen changes, and meal preparation. If a client needs therapeutic intervention, you assist with range-of-motion therapy, breathing assistance, or whatever other procedures are listed in the client's care plan.

KEY RESPONSBILITIES
  • Providing total personal care such as toileting, bathing, and perineal care.
  • Grooming, including oral care
  • Assist consumer with dressing and undressing
  • Assist in feeding consumers who are unable to feed themselves
  • Support good skin care to prevent skin breakdown (i.e. turn and reposition client, actively encourage movement)
  • Breathing Assistance (e.g. tracheostomy, respirator)
  • Assist client with active and passive range of motions as defined by the care plan.
  • Provide consumer with help walking and transferring
  • Assist consumer in the self-administration of medication.
  • Perform light housekeeping
  • Perform meal preparation and clean up
  • Change bed linens and make up the consumers bed
  • Maintain an orderly client environment.
Qualifications
  • High school diploma
  • Certification in CPR and first aid OR a willingness to become certified
  • Driver's license, a personal vehicle, and a willingness to travel to our service areas. (ex. Assisted Living Sites and/or Community Outreach)
  • Proof of full COVID-19 immunization
  • Experience working with persons with disabilities or in convalescent care.
  • Willing to work in home-care environment that may include exposure to bodily fluids, household cleaners, pets, and fluctuating room temperature.
A completed home service worker (HSW) or personal service worker (PSW) certificate would be preferred, but experience working/volunteering related fields is also considered. Do you have excellent people skills? Are you kind and patient? Can you work hard to ensure the well-being of our clients? If yes, you might just be perfect for this home care / personal support position!

JOB DETAILS

Status: Part-Time, Permanent

Hours: Approx. 16-32 Hrs/Week

Primary Location: Cambridge and Surrounding Area

Starting Wage: $18.75/Hour + $3/Hour pandemic temporary wage enhancement on direct service hours

WORK SCHEDULE

This position works a rotating schedule of mornings, afternoons, evenings, and alternating weekends, for example, 6:30 am - 2:30 pm or 2:30 pm - 11:00 pm.

ARE YOU READY TO JOIN OUR TEAM?

If you feel that you would be right for this home care / personal support job, please fill out our initial application on our website. We look forward to meeting you!

ILWR is committed to developing an inclusive, barrier-free selection process and work environment. We seek to provide accessibility for all applicants with disabilities consistent with our accessibility policies and the AODA. Please let us know if you require an accommodation and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs. We thank all applicants; however only those selected for an interview will be contacted

Education & Experience

  • Recent experience in a commercial or industrial laundry environment is a plus!
Knowledge, Skills & Abilities
  • Ability to communicate effectively both verbally and in writing.
  • Physical ability to carry out the duties of the position.
  • Ability to operate related equipment.
The hours of work including days off and work area may be subject to change consistent with operational requirements and the provision of the Collective Agreement and applicable statutes. Successful applicants may be required to complete a Criminal Records Review Check.

As per the current Public Health Orders (Long Term Care/Seniors Assisted Living Provincial Health Officer Order and the Health Sector Order), as of October 26, 2021, all employees working for Vancouver Coastal Health must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19. Proof of vaccination status will be required.

WHY JOIN VANCOUVER COASTAL HEALTH?

VCH is a world class innovator in medical care, research and teaching, delivering service to more than one million BC residents. At VCH, we embrace thinking boldly, taking smart risks, and "going first" when we believe it will lead to the best possible outcomes for patients and their families. We invite you to join us in creating healthy lives in healthy communities by showcasing our passion for care, connection to the communities we serve and our culture of teamwork that makes VCH a great place to work.
  • Comprehensive health benefits package, including MSP, extended health and dental and municipal pension plan
  • Grow your career with employer-paid training and leadership development opportunities
  • Wellness supports, including counselling, critical incident and innovative wellness services are available to employees and their immediate families
  • Award-winning recognition programs to honour staff, medical staff and volunteers
  • Access to exclusive discount offers and deals for VCH staff
Diversity, equity, and inclusion are essential to our goals of creating a great place to work and delivering exceptional care. We acknowledge and accommodate unique differences and ensure special measures are in place so that all prospective and current employees are given an opportunity to succeed.

We are committed to building a representative workforce and encourage applications reflecting diversity of sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, racialization or ancestry, disability, political belief, religion, marital or family status, age, and/or status as a First Nation, Metis, Inuit, or Indigenous person.

Vancouver Coastal Health is proud to be recognized as one of Canada's Top 100 Employers in 2022.

Only short-listed applicants will be contacted for this posting.

***Employees of VCH must apply via the Internal Application Process. Refer to the https//my.vch.ca/working-here/job-postings site for How to Apply instructions. Current VCH employees who apply to this posting using this external site will be considered as an external candidate. Seniority will not apply.***

Thank you for your interest in Vancouver Coastal Health.

title: Drywall Worker
description:
Are you looking for a great fit in a full-time construction job? Do you have a deep understanding of framing, building, and finishing? We are hiring for full-time and part-time Drywall Installers, or Drywallers, to join with one of our skilled labor clients. As a Drywaller, you work on home construction and restoration projects. You'll measure the rooms in which the building material is to be installed, cut it to fit these rooms, and attach the drywall to wall studs. Some Drywallers learn informally through on-the-job training, while others enter formal apprenticeships that might take three or four years to complete. Although no formal education is required for this occupation, a knowledge of basic math is essential.There are two basic steps to installing drywall: First, drywall workers fasten the drywall against the inside framework of the building. Second, they finish and smooth the joints. Some drywall workers specialize in cutting and installing the panels, while others specialize in finishing the joints. However, many workers do both types of work. Does this sound like the right fit for you? If so, then we would love to have you apply today.Note – Pay Rate for this Job is $15.00/HourShift Timing - All AvailableResponsibilities Include:
  • Reading design plans in order to provide minimal wallboard to avoid unnecessary waste of materials
  • Measuring and marking cutting lines on framing, drywall, and trim using tape measure, straightedge, or square, and marking devices
  • Identifying the exact locations of windows, electrical outlets, and plumbing, and then cutting the drywall or ceiling tile to fit the precise size needed
  • Cutting drywall to the right size, using utility knives and power saws
  • Fastening drywall panels to interior wall studs, using nails or screws
  • Installing metal corner beads to protect exterior corners
  • Filling joints, holes, and cracks with compound, using a trowel and broad knife
  • Trimming and smoothing rough edges so boards join evenly without visual defectQualifications:
  • One year of experience in residential or commercial carpentry preferred, as is mud and sanding applications experience
  • Basic math skills: addition, subtraction, multiplication, and division on the fly
  • Able to occasionally lift and move 50 pounds
  • Take pride in your strong work ethic, positive mindset, and desire to improve
  • References that verify your professional skills and experience
